title: How to Calculate Cost Savings Percentage

steps.title: Determine the original price of the product or service.
steps.content: Determine the original price of the product or service. For most purchases, this is the retail price before any coupons or discounts are applied. [1] X Research source For example, if the original, retail price of a sweater is $50, use $50 as your original price. For an hourly service, multiply the standard billing rate by the number of hours normally billed.

steps.title: Determine the new price of the product or service.
steps.content: Determine the new price of the product or service. This is the price after any sales promotions, discounts, coupons, or deals that you received on it. [2] X Research source For example, if you ultimately paid $40 for the sweater after all discounts, the new price is $40.

steps.title: Determine the price difference.
steps.content: Determine the price difference. To do this, subtract the new price from the original price. [3] X Research source In this example, the price difference is the original price of $50 minus $40, or $10.

steps.title: Divide the price difference by the original price.
steps.content: Divide the price difference by the original price. In this example, that’s $10 divided by the original $50 price tag, or 0.2.

steps.title: Multiply the decimal by 100 (or move the decimal point over two spaces to the right) to convert it to a percentage.
steps.content: Multiply the decimal by 100 (or move the decimal point over two spaces to the right) to convert it to a percentage. In this example, that’s 0.2 multiplied by 100, or 20 percent. This means you saved 20 percent on the purchase of the sweater. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Type the original price of the product or the service in cell A1 and hit enter.
steps.content: Type the original price of the product or the service in cell A1 and hit enter. For example, if the original price of a computer was $200, type “200” in cell A1.

steps.title: Type the final price after all discounts in cell B1 and hit enter.
steps.content: Type the final price after all discounts in cell B1 and hit enter. For example, if you ultimately paid $150 for the computer, type “150” in cell B1.

steps.title: Type the formula “=A1-B1” in cell C1 and hit enter.
steps.content: Type the formula “=A1-B1” in cell C1 and hit enter. When you do this, Excel automatically calculates the difference between the two prices and displays the numerical value in the cell. For this example, the numerical value in cell C1 should be 50 if you enter the formula correctly.

steps.title: Type the formula “=C1/A1” in cell D1 and hit enter.
steps.content: Type the formula “=C1/A1” in cell D1 and hit enter. When you do this, Excel divides the price difference by the original price. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source For this example, the numerical value in cell D1 should be 0.25 if you enter the formula correctly.

steps.title: Select cell D1 with your cursor and click “CRTL+SHIFT+%”.
steps.content: Select cell D1 with your cursor and click “CRTL+SHIFT+%”. When you do this, Excel converts the decimal into a percentage. [6] X Research source In this example, the value in cell D1 should be 25%. This means that you saved 25 percent on the purchase of the computer.

steps.title: Input new values in cells A1 and B1 to calculate cost savings percentage on other purchases.
steps.content: Input new values in cells A1 and B1 to calculate cost savings percentage on other purchases. Because you entered formulas into the other cells, Excel will automatically update the cost savings percentage when you change the original price or the final price, or both. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source For example, say you also purchased a lamp for $10 that originally cost $17. If you type “17” into cell A1 and “10” into B1 -- and leave all the other cells as they are – the corresponding savings of 41 percent will display in cell D1.
